result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Houston A Scott

records.addlTxt: Status conference on November 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.

8:51 AM Defendant Houston A Scott in court.  Attorney Elizabeth Martha Angove in court for Houston A Scott.  Attorney Raymond Robert Rutz III in court for State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter:  Nancy Szeklinski. 
Defense requests one more status, needs more time to negotiate with the State.
Status conference scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on September 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.

10:12 AM Prosecuting attorney Kelsey L. Blumenfeld in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Houston A Scott in court, in custody.  Attorney Elizabeth Martha Angove in court for Houston A Scott. Court Reporter:  Darlene Shue. 
Defense states defendant has another felony case, has received a new global offer.
Defense requests to modify bond in 22CF940 to $1,000 to $2,000 cash bond.
State obj.
BTC: Motion to modify bond in 22CF940 is denied.
Status conference scheduled for September 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.
DA AUTHORIZATION TO OBTAIN COPIES OF CERTAIN EVIDENCE

***ALSO $3500.00 SIGNATURE BOND*** Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit. No contact with George Webb restaurants. Defendant ordered not to possess or control any weapons.

8:49 AM Prosecuting attorney Dirk Christian Jensen in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Houston A Scott in court, in custody.  Attorney Elizabeth Martha Angove in court for Houston A Scott. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
Waiver of Preliminary hearing filed.  Probable cause found;  bound over. 
Defense has filed a bond motion, requesting $500 cash bond and or a signature bond,
State objects to any modification at this time
BTC: Bond motion granted to $3500 cash and $3500 signature bond.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 26, 2022 at 10:00 am.
